ru.yandex.subtitles.content.dao

Class AbstractIdentifyDAO<K,E extends Identify<K>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ru.yandex.subtitles.content.dao.AbstractReadOnlyDAO<E>
      • ru.yandex.subtitles.content.dao.AbstractIdentifyDAO<K,E>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MessagesDAO, PhrasesDAO, ThreadsDAO

    public abstract class AbstractIdentifyDAO<K,E extends Identify<K>>
extends AbstractReadOnlyDAO<E>
    Class provides read-write access and object-relation mapping to any data in content provider.

      • update

        protected int update(android.net.Uri uri,
         android.content.ContentValues values,
         java.lang.String selection,
         java.lang.String[] selectionArgs)
        Updates a set of column/value pair by using given content uri and selection.
        Parameters:
        uri - the URI to query. This can potentially have a record ID if this is an update request for a specific record.
        values - a set of column_name/value pairs to update in the database. This must not be null.
        selection - an optional filter to match rows to update.
        selectionArgs - a list of selection binding arguments.
        Returns:
        the number of rows affected.

        Parameters:

        values - an column/value pair.
        Returns:
        true if entity was updated or inserted, false otherwise.

      • toContentValues

        protected abstract android.content.ContentValues toContentValues(E entity)

        Implement that method to map your data entity to ContentValues.

        Here is the standard idiom for entity mapping: 

           public class MyDataDAO extends AbstractIdentifyDAO {

     ...

     protected ContentValues toContentValues(final MyData entity) {
         ContentValues values = new ContentValues();
         values.put(Columns._ID, entity.getId());
         values.put(Columns.INTEGER_COLUMN, entity.getInteger());
         values.put(Columns.STRING_COLUMN, entity.getString());
         return values;
     }

   }
        Parameters:
        entity - a data entity.
        Returns:
        an column/value pair.
